intro: Microlicia stenocladon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved microlicia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and produces clusters of tiny, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Microlicia stenocladon is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
